str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From katapauo; reposing down, i.e. abode.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.
